TopicTitle: Why is the Ion Engine in the Utility section?

Articles.Content:
Hi folks

This one always seems to get me, I look in the Propulsion section for the Ion engine and realise it's in Utility. Just wondering why it's there? It's a propulsion device, is it not. This also applies to the Xenon tanks, why aren't they in the Propulsion section with all the other various fuel tanks? Xenon is a fuel not a utility? I'm sure there's a very good reason for it that I've totally overlooked.

Thanks
No idea why, but you could use ModuleManager and a small patch to move them to propulsion if you like,
It is, but most people barely ever use it, so it would be extra clutter in Propulsion.
Also, if it really bothers you, just edit the cfg files for the engine and xenon tanks so that they're in 'Propulsion' rather than 'Utility'
Thanks for the replies. It's okay, it doesn't bother me. I was just wondering

Probably because it's the only propulsion device (other than RCS that has its own tab) that doesn't use liquidfuel. And if they stick the engine in utility they might as well put the tanks there as well.

Just a guess but that's the only explanation I could think of.

RCS has its own troubles, why are the thrusters and tanks in different tabs?

I think ions are in Utility tab to keep them close to the electrical system parts.

I'm hoping the new GUI in 0.4 brings us a new way to organize parts. The current method is fine for stock, but they know part mods are coming. There needs to be more divisions. Engines and Fuel need to be separated. Utility needs to be divided up between mechanical and electric. They keep talking about the new GUI and I'm hoping improvements to this will be included.

In general the way they organize items it very confusing for a beginner.

For me during first 3 day it's always been a problem to find stupid separators. I keep on looking for them under the engines section, cause they're separating the engines, but nope...

You know what would be good?

An option to search for an item by name or keyword. Say: I type in a search box "adapter" - and I get all adapters. I type "docking" and I get all docking ports. I type "landing" and I get all the wheels and landing struts.

You mean 0.24, right? 0.4 was a looooong time ago.

I don't like the current ordering, but I sort of like this game mechanic. If a user really cares and takes the time, the entire ordering can be managed directly.

I'm not saying that I necessarily like having to rename the directories, but I like the fact that I could organize my list my parts together by size while another user could organize by type (engines together, decouplers together, etc...).

Filters would work here too.
